an7.29:1.1: “These seven things lead to the decline of a lay follower.
an7.29:1.3: They miss out on seeing the mendicants.
an7.29:1.4: They neglect listening to the true teaching.
an7.29:1.5: They don’t train in higher ethical conduct.
an7.29:1.6: They’re very suspicious about mendicants, whether senior, junior, or middle.
an7.29:1.7: They listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.
an7.29:1.8: They seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
an7.29:1.10: These seven things lead to the decline of a lay follower.
an7.29:2.1: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a lay follower.
an7.29:2.3: They don’t miss out on seeing the mendicants.
an7.29:2.4: They don’t neglect listening to the true teaching.
an7.29:2.5: They train in higher ethical conduct.
an7.29:2.6: They’re very confident about mendicants, whether senior, junior, or middle.
an7.29:2.7: They don’t listen to the teaching with a hostile, fault-finding mind.
an7.29:2.8: They don’t seek outside of the Buddhist community for those worthy of religious donations.
an7.29:2.9: And they serve the Buddhist community first.
an7.29:2.10: These seven things don’t lead to the decline of a lay follower.”
an7.29:2.11: That is what the Buddha said.
an7.29:2.12: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
an7.29:3.1: “A lay follower misses out on seeing
an7.29:3.3: and listening to the teachings of the Noble One.
an7.29:3.4: They don’t train in higher ethical conduct,
an7.29:4.3: They want to listen to the true teaching
an7.29:5.1: They seek outside the Buddhist community
an7.29:5.2: for someone else worthy of religious donations,
an7.29:6.1: These seven principles leading to decline
an7.29:6.3: A lay follower who practices them
an7.29:6.4: falls away from the true teaching.
an7.29:7.1: A lay follower doesn’t miss out on seeing
an7.29:7.3: and listening to the teachings of the Noble One.
an7.29:7.4: They train in higher ethical conduct,
an7.29:8.3: They want to listen to the true teaching
an7.29:9.1: They don’t seek outside the Buddhist community
an7.29:9.2: for someone else worthy of religious donations,
an7.29:10.1: These seven principles that prevent decline
an7.29:10.3: A lay follower who practices them
an7.29:10.4: doesn’t fall away from the true teaching.”
